title: Top 9 Hawaii Guidebooks - General
text:
2. Frommer's Hawaii 2015 
The 2015 edition brings this book to near the top of the list of overall Hawaii guidebooks. With more interior maps than ever before, this definitive guide to the Hawaiian Islands features coverage of beaches, adventure tours, snorkeling, diving and golf as well as reviews of all major resorts and restaurants. More » Fodor's Hawaii 2016. Fodor's 
One of the best guides to Hawaii, updated every year. All reviews based on visits by savvy writer-residents. The guide includes lots of pages of maps, walking and driving tours, smart travel tips and much more. More » Moon Hawaiian Islands. Kevin Whitton 4. Moon Hawaiian Islands (Moon Handbooks) 
Covering all of the islands in detail, this book has been the winner of the Hawaii Visitor Bureau's "Best Guidebook" and "Overall Grand Excellence" awards. With almost 900 pages dedicated to guiding travelers to Hawaii and yet compact in size, this book is a best buy. Fortunately, the book has been totally updated by Kevin Whitton. More » Lonely Planet Hawaii. Lonely Planet 5. Lonely Planet Hawaii 
An insider's view on what's best to see and do and how to get around. Details on ocean sports and beach life are revealed, but this guide goes beyond to private hideaways, lush rainforests and plenty of opportunities for camping and hiking among the islands' unique landscapes. More » Hawaii for Dummies. Cheryl Farr Leas (Author), John Rosenthal (Author) 
Don't let the title fool you. Published by Frommer's, this book provides expert advice as well as basic tips and recommendations. It includes great maps, informative charts and quizzes to help you decide which islands are best for you. More » Greg Ward. The Rough Guide to Hawaii 
An excellent addition to the Rough Guide series, this book by Greg Ward contains well-researched, yet exceptionally easy to read practical tips and expert advice, as well as critical reviews of hundreds of restaurants, bars and hotels. More » DK Eyewitness Travel Guide: Hawaii. DK Publishing 
Recently updated in 2014, the DK Eyewitness Travel Guide to Hawaii continues the publisher's tradition of providing the most maps, photography, and illustrations of any guide on the market today. More » Off the Beaten Path® Hawaii. Sean Pager, Carrie Frasure 9. Off the Beaten Path®: Hawaii - A Guide to Unique Places 
For a totally new approach to Hawaii guidebooks, Off the Beaten Path® Hawaii takes the reader to places that are rarely if ever covered by other guidebooks, such as the amazing Hindu Monastery on Kauai. It recommends some of best "hole-in-the-wall" places to eat in the islands. More » Related Articles
